Container.Name: RedisInsight
Container.Overview:
***RedisInsight*** - The GUI for Redis.
This is a template for the **redislabs/redisinsight** container, with all the environment variables available at the time of writing (28-03-2023), as described at : https://docs.redis.com/latest/ri/installing/configurations/
***RedisInsight*** requires it's directories to be owned by 1001:1000 (or at least for that user to have read / write permissions). Assuming the directories used, will only be used by this container : - open an Unraid terminal and execute the following commands (without the quotes and replace /path/to/appdata with the path you define for **Data Dir** below) - (if the directory doesn't exist yet) copy/paste "mkdir /path/to/appdata" into the terminal, and hit enter - copy/paste "chown 1001:1000 /path/to/appdata" into the terminal, and hit enter

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Configures the log level of the application. Possible values are - DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR and CRITICAL.

Config.Name: Application Listen Port
Config.Description: Which port should RedisInsight listen on.

Config.Name: Application Listen Host
Config.Description: Which host should RedisInsight bind to.

Config.Name: Application Home Dir
Config.Description: Sets the storage directory where RedisInsight stores application data (such as local database, log files and snapshot files).

Config.Name: Application Log Dir
Config.Description: Sets the logging storage directory where RedisInsight stores application logs.

Config.Name: Trusted Origins
Config.Description: Configures the trusted origins of the application. Examples: https://my-website.com,https://my-another-website.com,http://my-third-website.com

Config.Name: Subpath Proxy
Config.Description: Enables Subpath Proxy for the application.

Config.Name: Subpath Proxy Path
Config.Description: Configures Subpath Proxy path for the application. Examples: /redisinsight, /myapp

Config.Name: Subpath Proxy Prefix
Config.Description: Sets the Subpath proxy prefix HTTP header field name for the application. The application uses the value from this HTTP header key as proxy subpath. Examples: X-Forwarded-Prefix, X-Forwarded-Path

Config.Name: Authentication Prompt
Config.Description: Enables authentication prompt that asks for authentication before opening an instance or when the user is idle.

Config.Name: Idle Timer
Config.Description: Idle timer value for authentication prompt, in minutes.
